alert.note: Alert for Eastern Essex; Eastern Norfolk; Eastern Plymouth; Suffolk (Massachusetts) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 21 at 10:20PM EDT by NWS Boston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Essex, northeastern Norfolk, central Suffolk and north central Plymouth Counties through 1115 PM EDT... At 1020 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Winthrop, or near Chelsea, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Strong winds could cause minor damage such as downed branches. Little to no impact from hail is expected. Locations impacted include... Boston, Quincy, Lynn, Weymouth, Revere, Peabody, Salem, Beverly, Chelsea, Gloucester, Saugus, Danvers, Hingham, Marblehead, Winthrop, Swampscott, Ipswich, Hull, Hamilton and Cohasset. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Get indoors when you hear thunder. Do not resume outdoor activities until at least 30 minutes after the storm has passed. Do not drive through flooded roads or underpasses. Avoid low lying areas near small streams. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. For your safety, go indoors or to your vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Essex; Eastern Norfolk; Eastern Plymouth; Suffolk
